Material used.Material Name: α-Synuclein (αS) peptides (WT, E46K, A30P, A53T, A30P/A53T)
Material used.Description: αS peptides were dissolved at a nominal concentration of 70 μM in 20 mM Tris buffer, pH 7.4.

Readout description.Result Description: E46K αS accelerated fibril formation compared to WT αS, with increased growth rate during the elongation phase.
A30P αS decelerated fibril formation compared to WT αS, with decreased growth rate during the elongation phase.
A53T αS accelerated fibril formation compared to WT αS, with increased growth rate during the elongation phase.
A30P/A53T αS accelerated fibril formation compared to WT αS, with increased growth rate during the elongation phase.

Biological replicates.Description: Each figure comprises data obtained with 3 independent experiments.

Technical replicates.Description: Fluorescence was determined three times at intervals of 10 s.

Basic negative control.Description: Fluorescence of a ThS blank was subtracted.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Fluorescence levels comparable to WT αS over time.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Significant deviation in fluorescence levels (increase or decrease) compared to WT αS over time.

Material used.Material Name: α-Synuclein (αS) peptides (WT, E46K, A30P, A53T, A30P/A53T)
Material used.Description: αS peptides were dissolved at a nominal concentration of 70 μM in 20 mM Tris buffer, pH 7.4.

Readout description.Result Description: E46K αS displayed substantially accelerated kinetics of secondary structure change (t1/2 ≈ 0.6 d) compared to WT αS (t1/2 ≈ 1.5 d).
A30P αS displayed slightly decelerated kinetics of secondary structure change (t1/2 ≈ 1.6 d) compared to WT αS (t1/2 ≈ 1.5 d).
A53T αS displayed slightly accelerated kinetics of secondary structure change (t1/2 ≈ 1.1 d) compared to WT αS (t1/2 ≈ 1.5 d).
A30P/A53T αS displayed slightly accelerated kinetics of secondary structure change (t1/2 ≈ 1.1 d) compared to WT αS (t1/2 ≈ 1.5 d).

Biological replicates.Description: Spectra presented at each time are representative of those obtained during each of 3 independent experiments.

Technical replicates.Description: Ten scans were acquired and averaged for each sample.

Basic negative control.Description: Raw data were manipulated by subtraction of buffer spectra.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Half-time (t1/2) for assembly-dependent conformational change was determined numerically.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Secondary structure transition kinetics comparable to WT αS (t1/2 ≈ 1.5 d).

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Significant deviation in secondary structure transition kinetics (faster or slower) compared to WT αS (t1/2 ≈ 1.5 d).

Material used.Material Name: α-Synuclein (αS) peptides (WT, E46K, A30P, A53T, A30P/A53T)
Material used.Description: αS peptides at a nominal concentration of 70 μM were mixed with tris(2,2′-bipyridyl)dichlororuthenium(II) hexahydrate and ammonium persulfate in 20 mM Tris buffer, pH 7.4.

Readout description.Result Description: E46K αS formed higher order oligomers (pentamers and hexamers) compared to WT αS (monomers to tetramers), with an oligomer/monomer ratio of 1.98 ± 0.07.
A30P αS formed lower order oligomers (monomers to trimers) compared to WT αS (monomers to tetramers), with an oligomer/monomer ratio of 0.73 ± 0.02.
A53T αS showed a similar oligomer distribution to WT αS (monomers to tetramers), with an oligomer/monomer ratio of 1.63 ± 0.12.
A30P/A53T αS showed a similar oligomer distribution to WT αS (monomers to tetramers), with an oligomer/monomer ratio of 1.68 ± 0.12.

Biological replicates.Description: The gel is representative of three independent experiments.

Basic negative control.Description: Noncross-linked samples were used as controls in each experiment.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Oligomer/monomer ratios were calculated as mean ± S.E. (n=3).

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Oligomer distribution and oligomer/monomer ratio comparable to WT αS (monomers to tetramers, ratio ≈ 1.64).

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Significant deviation in oligomer distribution or oligomer/monomer ratio compared to WT αS (higher or lower order oligomers, ratio significantly different from 1.64).

Material used.Material Name: α-Synuclein (αS) peptides (WT, E46K, A30P, A53T, A30P/A53T)
Material used.Description: αS peptides at 70 μM were incubated at 37 °C for 7 days in 20 mM Tris buffer, pH 7.4.

Readout description.Result Description: Cross-linked oligomers of E46K αS had the largest globules with an average diameter of 14.97 ± 1.81 nm compared to WT αS (10.85 ± 1.05 nm).
Cross-linked oligomers of A30P αS had smaller globules with an average diameter of 9.99 ± 0.58 nm compared to WT αS (10.85 ± 1.05 nm).
Cross-linked oligomers of A53T αS had a similar morphology with an average diameter of 10.79 ± 0.82 nm compared to WT αS (10.85 ± 1.05 nm).
Cross-linked oligomers of A30P/A53T αS had a similar morphology with an average diameter of 10.98 ± 0.97 nm compared to WT αS (10.85 ± 1.05 nm).

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Diameters of assemblies were measured and expressed as mean ± S.E. (n=10).

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Oligomer morphology and diameter comparable to WT αS (average diameter ≈ 10.85 nm).

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Significant deviation in oligomer morphology or diameter compared to WT αS (average diameter significantly different from 10.85 nm).

Material used.Material Name: α-Synuclein (αS) peptides (WT, E46K, A30P, A53T, A30P/A53T)
Material used.Description: αS peptides at 70 μM were characterized using a Nanoscope IIIa controller with a multimode scanning probe microscope.

Readout description.Result Description: Cross-linked oligomers of E46K αS had the largest globules with an average height of 3.36 ± 0.44 nm compared to WT αS (1.51 ± 0.12 nm).
Cross-linked oligomers of A30P αS had smaller globules with an average height of 1.16 ± 0.17 nm compared to WT αS (1.51 ± 0.12 nm).
Cross-linked oligomers of A53T αS had a similar morphology with an average height of 1.46 ± 0.21 nm compared to WT αS (1.51 ± 0.12 nm).
Cross-linked oligomers of A30P/A53T αS had a similar morphology with an average height of 1.62 ± 0.15 nm compared to WT αS (1.51 ± 0.12 nm).

Technical replicates.Description: At least four regions of the mica surface were examined to confirm homogeneity.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Mean particle heights were analyzed as mean ± S.E. by averaging eight individual cross-sectional line scans.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Oligomer height comparable to WT αS (average height ≈ 1.51 nm).

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Significant deviation in oligomer height compared to WT αS (average height significantly different from 1.51 nm).
